input.description: The name of the adapter to use to handle the request. Default adapter name: HPSCActor.

The items for the adapter request. This should be an XML document with a root element named "items" having a child "item", which should contain the data necessary to execute the specific request. To execute multiple item, give multiple <item> element in the <items> element.
Create Problem:
This wrapper create a problem record.
Sample Item Xml:
<items> <item> <operation-name>create-problem</operation-name> <model> <keys> <id> <value>P-0007</value> <type>String</type> </id> </keys> <instance> <id> <value>P-0007</value> <type>String</type> </id>
<incident-category> <value>shared infrastructure</value> <type>String</type> </incident-category> <subcategory> <value>workgroup</value> <type>String</type> </subcategory> <product-type> <value>applications</value> <type>String</type> </product-type> <problem-type> <value>none</value> <type>String</type> </problem-type> <initial-impact> <value>2</value> <type>String</type> </initial-impact> <severity> <value>2</value> <type>String</type> </severity> <description> <type>Array</type> <description> <element> <value>description line 1</value> <type>String</type> </element> <element> <value>description line 2</value> <type>String</type> </element> </description> </description> <assignment> <value>AUTO</value> <type>String</type> </assignment> <ticket-owner> <value>CA 1</value> <type>String</type> </ticket-owner>
<category> <value>ITIL</value> <type>String</type> </category> <status> <value>Status</value> <type>String</type> </status> <logical-name> <value>AA</value> <type>String</type> </logical-name> <brief-description> <value>brief description</value> <type>String</type> </brief-description> <root-cause> <type>Array</type> <root-cause> <element> <value>root cause line 1</value> <type>String</type> </element> <element> <value>root cause line 2</value> <type>String</type> </element> </root-cause> </root-cause> <update> <type>Array</type> <update> <element> <value>update line 1</value> <type>String</type> </element> <element> <value>update line 2</value> <type>String</type> </element> </update> </update> <open> <value>true</value> <type>Boolean</type> </open> <open-time> <value>2008.11.01 08:00:00</value> <type>DateTime</type> </open-time> <opened-by> <value>opened by</value> <type>String</type> </opened-by> <update-time> <value>2008.11.01 08:00:00</value> <type>DateTime</type> </update-time> <updated-by> <value>updated by</value> <type>String</type> </updated-by> <close-time> <value>2008.11.01 08:00:00</value> <type>DateTime</type> </close-time> <closed-by> <value>closed by</value> <type>String</type> </closed-by> <reopen-time> <value>2008.11.01 08:00:00</value> <type>DateTime</type> </reopen-time> <reopened-by> <value>reopened by</value> <type>String</type> </reopened-by> <priority-code> <value>1</value> <type>String</type> </priority-code>
<sysmodtime> <value>2007.11.01 08:00:00</value> <type>DateTime</type> </sysmodtime> <sysmodcount> <value>2</value> <type>Decimal</type> </sysmodcount> <sysmoduser> <value>sysmoduser</value> <type>String</type> </sysmoduser> <assignee-name> <value>assignee name</value> <type>String</type> </assignee-name> <company> <value>company</value> <type>String</type> </company> <dump> <value>dump</value> <type>String</type> </dump> <resolution> <type>Array</type> <resolution> <element> <value>resolution line 1</value> <type>String</type> </element> <element> <value>resolution line 2</value> <type>String</type> </element> </resolution> </resolution> <workaround> <type>workaround</type> <workaround> <element> <value>workaround line 1</value> <type>String</type> </element> <element> <value>workaround line 2</value> <type>String</type> </element> </workaround> </workaround> <current-phase> <value>Problem Identification and Classification</value> <type>String</type> </current-phase> <incident-count> <value>3</value> <type>Decimal</type> </incident-count> <future-impact> <value>3</value> <type>String</type> </future-impact> <impact> <value>1</value> <type>String</type> </impact> <users-affected> <value>10</value> <type>Decimal</type> </users-affected> <problem-start-time> <value>2008.11.01 08:00:00</value> <type>DateTime</type> </problem-start-time> <expected-resolution-time> <value>2008.11.01 08:00:00</value> <type>DateTime</type> </expected-resolution-time> <location-type> <value>location type</value> <type>String</type> </location-type> <frequency> <value>frequencey</value> <type>String</type> </frequency> <proposed-solution> <value>proposed solution</value> <type>String</type> </proposed-solution> <review-notes> <value>review notes</value> <type>String</type> </review-notes> <cause-code> <value>cause code</value> <type>String</type> </cause-code>
<affected-ci> <type>Array</type> <affected-ci> <element> <type>Structure</type> <ci-device-name> <value>AA</value> <type>String</type> </ci-device-name> <ci-device-type> <value>ci device type</value> <type>String</type> </ci-device-type> <ci-assign-group> <value>ci assignm group</value> <type>String</type> </ci-assign-group> <ci-location> <value>ci location</value> <type>String</type> </ci-location> </element> </affected-ci> </affected-ci> <affected-companies> <type>Array</type> <affected-companies> <element> <value>affected companies line 1</value> <type>String</type> </element> <element> <value>affected companies line 2</value> <type>String</type> </element> </affected-companies> </affected-companies> <affected-ci-count> <value>20</value> <type>Decimal</type> </affected-ci-count> <last-task-no> <value>11</value> <type>Decimal</type> </last-task-no> <agreement-id> <value>12</value> <type>Decimal</type> </agreement-id> <contract-id> <value>13</value> <type>Decimal</type> </contract-id> <sla-breach> <value>true</value> <type>Boolean</type> </sla-breach> <next-breach> <value>2008.11.01 08:00:00</value> <type>DateTime</type> </next-breach> </instance> </model> </item> </items>
Elements’ Description:
Operation-name[Required]: Valid value: <operation-name>create-problem</operation-name>
Id [Optional]: unique id for the application. Valid values: any unique string. Default value: system generated unique string.
Incident-category [Required], subcategory [Required], product-type [Required], problem-type [Required]: some specific combinations is required to create the record. For example (telecom, fixed infrastructure, fixed infrastructure, none.) Initial-impact [Required]: Valid values: 1, 2, 3, 4. 1 > Enterprise, 2 > Site/Dept, 3 > Multiple User, 4 > User.
Severity[Required]: Valid values: 1, 2, 3, 4. 1 > critical, 2 > high, 3 > average, 4 > low.
Description [Required]: Valid values: It’s an array type element with each of its element can take String as input.
Assignment [Required]: Valid values: one of list of assignment group. For example, AUTO, CLIENT SECURITY etc.
ticket-owner [Required]: Valid values: one of list of problem owners. For example CA 1, CA 2 etc.
category [Optional]: Valid values: ITIL Default value: DEFAULT
Note: We have only the ‘ITIL’ in rootcausecat table. So, we are constraint to choose only to ITIL for category.
status [Optional]: (NOT writable.) This field is set by application itself. The possible status are- open, closed, updated, assigned, work-in-progress, cancelled etc. Default value: Open.
Logical-name [Optional]: Valid values: Logical name of any EXISTING configuration item Default value: “”.
brief-description [Optional]: Valid values: any string. Default value: “”.
root-cause: Valid values: It's an array type element with each element can have any string value. Default value: “”.
update [Optional]: Valid values: It's an array type element with each element can have any string value. Defaut value: “”.
open [Optional]: (NOT writable) Valid values: this field is maintained by application itself. Possible values of it are true or false.It keeps information whether the interaction record is opened of not. Open -> true: interaction record is opened, open -> false: interaction record is not opened. Default value: true (because when we create a record for first time, its status be “open”.)
open-time [Optional]: Valid values: any input in date time format. Default value: system time, when it was opened.
Opened-by [Optional]: Valid values: any string. Default value: user that's using the webservice (e.g., ”falcon”.)
update-time [Optional]: (NOT writable.) This field is maintained by application itself. The possible values are of “DateTime” format. Default value: system time of last update (for first time, it's create time.)
updated-by [Optional]: (NOT writable.) This field is maintained by application itself. The value can be any string. Default value: the user who had updated the record (e.g., “falcon”.)
close-time [Optional]: (NOT writable.) This field is maintained by application itself. The possible values are of “DateTime” format. Default value: the time when the record was closed.
Closed-by [Optional]: (NOT writable.) This field is maintained by application itself. Possible values are string type. Default value: the user who had closed the record (e.g., “falcon”.) reopen-time [Optinal]: Valid values: any input in date time format. Default value: the time when record was reopened.
Reopened-by [Optional]: Valid values: any stirng. Default value: the user who had reopened the record.
Priority-code [Optional]: (NOT writable.) This element is maintained by application itself. Its value is same as that of <initial-impact> element. sysmodtime [Optional]: (NOT writable.) This element is maintained by application itself. It's of “DateTime” format. Default value: system time.
Sysmodcount [Optional]: (NOT writable.) This element is maintained by application itself. It's of “String” type. Default value: 0
sysmoduser [Optional]: (NOT writable.) This element is maintained by application itself. It's of string. Type. Default value: the webservice user (e.g., “falcon”.)
assignee-name [Optional]: Valid values: Any string. Default value: “”.
company [Optional]: Valid values: any string. Default value: “”.
dump [Optional]: Valid values: any string. Default value: “”.
resolution [Optional]: Valid values: it's an array type element with each of its element of string type. Default value: “”.
work-around [Optional]: Valid values: it's an array type element with each of its element of string type. Default value: “”.
current-phase [Optional]: Valid values: For given category ‘ITIL’ in <category> element, there are two possible phases- “Problem Identification and Classification” and “Problem Investigation and Diagnosis”.
Default value: “”.
Note: these entries can be seen in application in ‘rootcausephase’ table.
incident-count [Optional]: Valid values: Any decimal. Default value: “”.
future-impact [Optional]: Valid values: any string. Default value: “”.
impact [Optional]: Valid values: any string. Default value: “”.
users-affected [Optional]: Valid values: any decimal. Default value: “”.
problem-start-time [Optional]: Valid values: any input in “DateTime” format. Default value: “”. expected-resolution-time [Optional]: Valid values: any input in “DateTime” format. Default value: “”.
frequency [Optional]: Valid values: any string. Default value: “”.
proposed-solution [Optional]: Valid values: any string. Default value: “”.
review-notes [Optional]: Valid values: any string. Default value: “”.
cause-code [Optional]: Valid values: any string. Default value: “”.
affected-ci [Optional]: This is an array type of elment, with each of its element describes some particular configuration item.
Ci-device-name [Optional]: Valid values: any string. Default value: “”.
ci-device-type [Optional]: Valid values: any string. Default value: “”.
ci-assign-group [Optional]: Valid values: any string. Default value: “”.
ci-location [Optional]: Valid values: any string. Default value: “”.
affected-companies [Optional]: Valid values: It's an array type of element with each of its element of string type. Default value: “” for each element.
Affected-ci-count [Optional]: (NOT writable.) This field is maintained by application itself. It's of “Decimal” type. Default value: number of configuration item affected (number of <element> in <affected-ci>.)
last-task-no [Optional]: Valid values: any decimal. Default value: “”.
agreement-id [Optional]: Valid values: any decimal. Default value: “”.
contract-id [Optional]: Valid values: any decimal. Default values: “”.
sla-breach [Optional]: Valid values: true, false. Default value: “”.
next-breach [Optional]: Valid values: any input of “DateTime” format. Default value: “”.

Provide username/password in form of xml.
This input parameter is required when the user wants to override the default values for username and password provided in the adapter configuration. This is required for cases where an operation cannot be executed with the default username/password provided in the adapter configuration and only user with special permissions can execute the operation. Examples of such operations can be - 'approve-change', 'deny-change', 'close-change', 'approve-task'
Sample XML Format:
<connection-parameters> <alternate-username>USERNAME</alternate-username> <alternate-password>PASSWORD</alternate-password> </connection-parameters>

output.description: The adapter response containing the results.

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="no" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <request-data> <hp-service-center-request> <xsl:if test="username/text() != """> <username>${username}</username> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="password/text() != """> <password>${password}</password> </xsl:if> <entity> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">problem</xsl:text> </entity> <entity-type> <xsl:copy-of select="(//entity-type)[1]/text()" /> </entity-type> <request> <operation-name> <xsl:copy-of select="(//operation-name)[1]/text()" /> </operation-name> <xsl:for-each select="/items/item"> <parameters> <xsl:element name="${request element}"> <xsl:copy-of select="./model" /> </xsl:element> </parameters> </xsl:for-each> </request> </hp-service-center-request> </request-data> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

documentation.description:
Create Problem:
This wrapper create a problem record.
